142 // [48] Scheduler (SC) records

331//${QS-macros::QS_BEGIN_ID} ..................................................
332#define QS_BEGIN_ID(rec_, qs_id_) \
333if (QS_GLB_CHECK_(rec_) && QS_LOC_CHECK_(qs_id_)) { \
334 QS_CRIT_STAT \
335 QS_CRIT_ENTRY(); \
336 QS_MEM_SYS(); \
337 QP::QS::beginRec_(static_cast<std::uint_fast8_t>(rec_)); \
338 QS_TIME_PRE_(); {
339
340//${QS-macros::QS_END} .......................................................
341#define QS_END() } \
342 QP::QS::endRec_(); \
343 QS_MEM_APP(); \
344 QS_CRIT_EXIT(); \
345}
346
347//${QS-macros::QS_FLUSH} .....................................................
348#define QS_FLUSH() (QP::QS::onFlush())
349
350//${QS-macros::QS_BEGIN_INCRIT} ..............................................
351#define QS_BEGIN_INCRIT(rec_, qs_id_) \
352if (QS_GLB_CHECK_(rec_) && QS_LOC_CHECK_(qs_id_)) { \
353 QP::QS::beginRec_(rec_); \
354 QS_TIME_PRE_(); {
355
356//${QS-macros::QS_END_INCRIT} ................................................
357#define QS_END_INCRIT() } \
358 QP::QS::endRec_(); \
359}

361//${QS-macros::QS_GLB_CHECK_} ................................................
362#define QS_GLB_CHECK_(rec_) \
363((static_cast<std::uint_fast8_t>(QP::QS::filt_.glb[ \
364 static_cast<std::uint_fast8_t>(rec_) >> 3U]) \
365 & (static_cast<std::uint_fast8_t>(1U) \
366 << (static_cast<std::uint_fast8_t>(rec_) & 7U))) != 0U)
367

504//${QS-macros::QS_SIG} .......................................................
505#if (Q_SIGNAL_SIZE == 2U)
506#define QS_SIG(sig_, obj_) \
507 QP::QS::u16_fmt_(QP::QS::SIG_T, static_cast<std::uint16_t>(sig_)); \
508 QP::QS::obj_raw_(obj_)
509#endif // (Q_SIGNAL_SIZE == 2U)
510
511//${QS-macros::QS_SIG} .......................................................
512#if (Q_SIGNAL_SIZE == 4U)
513#define QS_SIG(sig_, obj_) \
514 QP::QS::u32_fmt_(QP::QS::SIG_T, static_cast<std::uint32_t>(sig_)); \
515 QP::QS::obj_raw_(obj_)
516#endif // (Q_SIGNAL_SIZE == 4U)
517
518//${QS-macros::QS_SIG_DICTIONARY} ............................................
519#define QS_SIG_DICTIONARY(sig_, obj_) \
520 (QP::QS::sig_dict_pre_((sig_), (obj_), #sig_))
521
522//${QS-macros::QS_OBJ_DICTIONARY} ............................................
523#define QS_OBJ_DICTIONARY(obj_) \
524 (QP::QS::obj_dict_pre_((obj_), #obj_))
525
526//${QS-macros::QS_OBJ_ARR_DICTIONARY} ........................................
527#define QS_OBJ_ARR_DICTIONARY(obj_, idx_) \
528 (QP::QS::obj_arr_dict_pre_((obj_), (idx_), #obj_))
529
530//${QS-macros::QS_FUN_DICTIONARY} ............................................

534
535//${QS-macros::QS_USR_DICTIONARY} ............................................
536#define QS_USR_DICTIONARY(rec_) \
537 (QP::QS::usr_dict_pre_((rec_), #rec_))
538

542
543//${QS-macros::QS_QF_CRIT_ENTRY} .............................................
544#define QS_QF_CRIT_ENTRY() (QP::QS::crit_entry_pre_())
545
546//${QS-macros::QS_QF_CRIT_EXIT} ..............................................

556
557//${QS-macros::QS_ONLY} ......................................................
558#define QS_ONLY(code_) (code_)
559
560//${QS-macros::QS_ASSERTION} .................................................
561#define QS_ASSERTION(module_, id_, delay_) \

702//$declare${QS::QS-TX} vvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvv
703namespace QP {
704namespace QS {
705
706//${QS::QS-TX::preType} ......................................................
707//! Enumerates data elements for app-specific trace records
708enum preType : std::uint8_t {
709 I8_ENUM_T, //!< signed 8-bit integer or enum format
710 U8_T, //!< unsigned 8-bit integer format
711 I16_T, //!< signed 16-bit integer format
712 U16_T, //!< unsigned 16-bit integer format
713 I32_T, //!< signed 32-bit integer format
714 U32_T, //!< unsigned 32-bit integer format
715 F32_T, //!< 32-bit floating point format
716 F64_T, //!< 64-bit floating point format
717 STR_T, //!< zero-terminated ASCII string format
718 MEM_T, //!< up to 255-bytes memory block format
719 SIG_T, //!< event signal format
720 OBJ_T, //!< object pointer format
721 FUN_T, //!< function pointer format
722 I64_T, //!< signed 64-bit integer format
723 U64_T //!< unsigned 64-bit integer format
724};
725
726//${QS::QS-TX::force_cast} ...................................................
727template<typename T_OUT, typename T_IN>
728inline T_OUT force_cast(T_IN in) {
729 union TCast {
730 T_IN in;
731 T_OUT out;
732 } u = { in };
733 return u.out;
734}
735
736//${QS::QS-TX::initBuf} ......................................................
737void initBuf(
738 std::uint8_t * const sto,
739 std::uint_fast32_t const stoSize) noexcept;
740
741//${QS::QS-TX::getByte} ......................................................
742std::uint16_t getByte() noexcept;
743
744//${QS::QS-TX::getBlock} .....................................................
745std::uint8_t const * getBlock(std::uint16_t * const pNbytes) noexcept;

748void doOutput();

791//$declare${QS::QS-RX} vvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvv
792namespace QP {
793namespace QS {
794
795//${QS::QS-RX::QSpyObjKind} ..................................................
796//! Kinds of objects used QS-RX
797enum QSpyObjKind : std::uint8_t {
798 SM_OBJ, //!< state machine object
799 AO_OBJ, //!< active object
800 MP_OBJ, //!< event pool object
801 EQ_OBJ, //!< raw queue object
802 TE_OBJ, //!< time event object
803 AP_OBJ, //!< generic Application-specific object
804 MAX_OBJ
805};
806
807//${QS::QS-RX::OSpyObjCombnation} ............................................
808//! Object combinations for QS-RX
809enum OSpyObjCombnation : std::uint8_t {
810 SM_AO_OBJ = MAX_OBJ //!< combination of SM and AO
811};
812
813//${QS::QS-RX::rxInitBuf} ....................................................
814void rxInitBuf(
815 std::uint8_t * const sto,
816 std::uint16_t const stoSize) noexcept;
817
818//${QS::QS-RX::rxPut} ........................................................
819inline bool rxPut(std::uint8_t const b) noexcept {
820 // NOTE: does not need critical section
821 // But requires system-level memory access (QF_MEM_SYS()).
822
823 QSCtr head = rxPriv_.head + 1U;
824 if (head == rxPriv_.end) {
825 head = 0U;
826 }
827 if (head != rxPriv_.tail) { // buffer NOT full?
828 rxPriv_.buf[rxPriv_.head] = b;
829 rxPriv_.head = head;
830 return true; // byte placed in the buffer
831 }
832 else {
833 return false; // byte NOT placed in the buffer
834 }
835}
836
837//${QS::QS-RX::rxParse} ......................................................
838void rxParse();
839
840//${QS::QS-RX::rxGetNfree} ...................................................
841std::uint16_t rxGetNfree() noexcept;
842
843//${QS::QS-RX::doInput} ......................................................
844void doInput();
845
846//${QS::QS-RX::onReset} ......................................................
847void onReset();
848
849//${QS::QS-RX::onCommand} ....................................................
850void onCommand(
851 std::uint8_t cmdId,
852 std::uint32_t param1,
853 std::uint32_t param2,
854 std::uint32_t param3);
855
856} // namespace QS
857} // namespace QP

977#define QS_TEST_PROBE_DEF(fun_) \
978 std::uint32_t const qs_tp_ = \
979 QP::QS::getTestProbe_(QP::QS::force_cast<void (*)()>(fun_));
980
981#define QS_TEST_PROBE(code_) \
982 if (qs_tp_ != 0U) { code_ }
983
984#define QS_TEST_PROBE_ID(id_, code_) \
985 if (qs_tp_ == static_cast<std::uint32_t>(id_)) { code_ }
986
987#define QS_TEST_PAUSE() (QP::QS::test_pause_())
988
989#else // Q_UTEST not defined
990
991// dummy definitions when not building for QUTEST
992#define QS_TEST_PROBE_DEF(fun_)
993#define QS_TEST_PROBE(code_)
994#define QS_TEST_PROBE_ID(id_, code_)
995#define QS_TEST_PAUSE() (static_cast<void>(0))
996
997#endif // Q_UTEST
